page.title: 14GUILDFORD: TRANSPORT
page.content: Guildford is an important route centre. Many main roads pass through it eg. the A3 (London-Portsmouth), the A31 (to Farnham), the A3100 and A320. Guildford has access to the new London Orbital Motorway (M25) via the A3. The High St. is now the focus of an experimental pedestrianisation scheme. The Friary Bus Station serves the whole Guildford area. Guildford has two railway stations London Rd. and the main-line station which has services to London (Waterloo Station), Portsmouth, Reading and Aldershot. There are a few trains which go to Leeds and Manchester via Reading. There are regular bus and train services to Heathrow and Gatwick airports. {By Jo Porter, Rachel Knight, Sarah { Witt and Vivienne Avery}
